DOC.detailed_description: This biomarker-driven study use observational design examine subgroup patient randomize , control trial `` Physical Fitness Training Subacute Stroke '' ( PHYS-STROKE ) . In PHYS-STROKE , 215 patient subacute stroke ( hemorrhagic ischemic ) receive either 4-weeks physical training ( aerobic training , 5 time week , 50 minute ) 4-weeks relaxation session ( 5 time week , 50 minute ) . A convenience sample 100 patient ischemic stroke include BAPTISe receive magnetic resonance imaging ( MRI ) scan blood test PHYS-STROKE intervention . Imaging scan address parameter cerebral perfusion vessel size imaging . Blood test determine several parameter immunity , inflammation ( include neopterin , MMP-9 ) , metabolism ( include ApoCIII , oxidize LDL , HOMA-index , uric acid , CK-MB , cystatin c , leptin ) , cytokine ( osteopontin , adiponectin ) , endothelial function ( SDF1-alpha , ADMA , sICAM , sVCAM , E-selectin , P-selectin ) . Additionally , assess association functional outcome ( co-primary outcome measure PHYS-STROKE ) biomarkers include image result .
